function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is a Samsung Store where users can browse and purchase Samsung products, specifically focusing on the Galaxy S10 series phones. It features product listings with images, prices, and 'add to cart' buttons. Users can view the cart, remove items, and proceed to checkout.","new_testing_goal":"Test the functionality of proceeding to checkout from the cart.","explanation":"Click on the 'checkout' button in the cart to proceed to the checkout page.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r7:"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.

Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is a Samsung Store with options to browse different products and add them to the cart.","new_testing_goal":"Test the functionality of adding products to the cart.","explanation":"Click on the 'Add to cart' button for one of the products to add it to the cart.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"1:r4:"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is a Samsung Store where users can browse and purchase Samsung products. It currently displays a selection of Galaxy S10 series phones with prices and 'add to cart' buttons for each product.","new_testing_goal":"Test the functionality of removing an item from the cart.","explanation":"Click on the 'remove' button for the first item in the cart to remove it from the cart.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":rc:"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is a Samsung Store showcasing Galaxy S10 series phones for purchase. Users can add products to the cart and view the cart with options to remove items.","new_testing_goal":"Test the functionality of clearing the entire cart.","explanation":"Click on the 'clear cart' button to remove all items from the cart.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r6:"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is a Samsung Store selling Galaxy S10 series phones. Users can browse and add products to the cart.","new_testing_goal":"Test the functionality of viewing the cart and proceeding to checkout.","explanation":"Click on the cart icon to view the items in the cart and then click on the 'checkout' button to proceed to checkout.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r2:"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.
Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Test the functionality of viewing the cart and proceeding to checkout..

Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Test the functionality of adding products to the cart.": 1, "Test the functionality of removing an item from the cart.": 1, "Test the functionality of clearing the entire cart.": 1, "Test the functionality of viewing the cart and proceeding to checkout.": 1}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.
Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :r6:, :r8:, :ra:, :rb:, :r9:, :r7:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with
